data.chText: 手势；姿势；示意动作
data.enText: a movement that you make with your hands, your head or your face to show a particular meaning

data.chText: 他向另外那辆汽车的司机做了个粗野的手势。
data.enText: He made a rude gesture at the driver of the other car.

data.chText: 她用绝望的姿势结束了她不得不讲的话。
data.enText: She finished what she had to say with a gesture of despair.

data.chText: 他们完全用手势交流。
data.enText: They communicated entirely by gesture.

data.chText: （表明感情或意图的）姿态，表示
data.enText: something that you do or say to show a particular feeling or intention

data.chText: 他们送了一些花表示对孩子父母的同情。
data.enText: They sent some flowers as a gesture of sympathy to the parents of the child.

data.chText: 把他的妻子也请来是友好的表示。
data.enText: It was a nice gesture (= it was kind) to invite his wife too.

data.chText: 我们不承担责任，不过我们愿意退款以表示我们的善意。
data.enText: We do not accept responsibility but we will refund the money as a gesture of goodwill .

data.chText: 政府已做出顺应民意的姿态。
data.enText: The government has made a gesture towards public opinion (= has tried to do sth that the public will like) .

data.chText: 做手势；用手势表示；用动作示意
data.enText: to move your hands, head, face, etc. as a way of expressing what you mean or want

data.chText: “看来你读了很多书。”他指着那一墙的书说道。
data.enText: ‘I see you read a lot,’ he said, gesturing at the wall of books.

data.chText: 她示意让他们进来。
data.enText: She gestured for them to come in.

data.chText: 他示意（我）该走了。
data.enText: He gestured (to me) that it was time to go.

data.chText: 他们示意让我跟在后面。
data.enText: They gestured that I should follow.

data.text: action ♦ move ♦ act ♦ gesture ♦ deed ♦ feat

data.chText: 以上各词均指行为、行动。
data.enText: These are all words for a thing that sb does.
action

data.chText: 指行动、动作：
data.enText: a thing that sb does

data.chText: 她行动迅速，救了小孩的命。
data.enText: Her quick action saved the child's life.
move

data.chText: （尤用于新闻）指为达到某目标而采取或需要采取的行动：
data.enText: (used especially in journalism) an action that you do or need to do to achieve sth

data.chText: 他们在等待民意测验的结果，然后再决定下一步行动。
data.enText: They are waiting for the results of the opinion polls before deciding their next move.
act

data.chText: 指行为、行动、所为：
data.enText: a thing that sb does

data.chText: 善行
data.enText: an act of kindness

data.chText: 用action还是act？
这两个词意义相同，但用于不同的句型。act后常跟of，而且 / 或常与形容词连用。action通常不与of连用，但常与his、her等词连用：
data.enText: These two words have the same meaning but are used in different patterns. An act is usually followed by of and/or used with an adjective. Action is not usually used with of but is often used with his , her , etc.

data.chText: 英勇壮举
data.enText: a heroic act of bravery
a heroic action of bravery

data.chText: 他在战争中的英雄壮举
data.enText: his heroic actions/acts during the war

data.chText: action常与take搭配，act则不能：
data.enText: Action often combines with take but act does not.
We shall take whatever acts are necessary.
action or act?
gesture

data.chText: 指表达情感或意图的举动或言语：
data.enText: a thing that you do or say to show a particular feeling or intention

data.chText: 他们送了一些花表示慰问。
data.enText: They sent some flowers as a gesture of sympathy.
deed

data.chText: 通常指良好或不良的行为、行动：
data.enText: ( formal , literary ) a thing that sb does that is usually very good or very bad

data.chText: 英雄事迹；罪恶行为
data.enText: heroic/evil deeds
feat

data.chText: 指需要技巧、气力或勇气的成就或业绩：
data.enText: ( approving ) an action or piece of work that needs skill, strength or courage

data.chText: 这条隧道是工程方面的辉煌成就。
data.enText: The tunnel is a brilliant feat of engineering.
a(n) act/gesture/feat of sth
to perform a(n) action/act/deed/feat
to make a move/gesture
a heroic/brave/daring action/move/act/gesture/deed/feat
a kind/charitable/generous action/act/gesture/deed
a(n) evil/terrible action/act/deed

simple_means.memory_skill: gest 带来 + ure 表行为 → 能带来信息的动作 → 手势

means: (表明感情或意图的)姿态，表示

tr: motion of hands or body to emphasize or help to express a thought or feeling
something done as an indication of intention
the use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
show, express or direct through movement
example: He gestured his desire to leave

value.def: A gesture is a movement that you make with a part of your body, especially your hands, to express emotion or information.

example.ex: Sarah made a menacing gesture with her fist...
example.tran: 萨拉用拳头做了一个威胁性的动作。

example.ex: He throws his hands open in a gesture which clearly indicates his relief.
example.tran: 他摊开双手，明确表示他已如释重负。

value.def: A gesture is something that you say or do in order to express your attitude or intentions, often something that you know will not have much effect.

example.ex: He questioned the government's commitment to peace and called on it to make a gesture of good will...
example.tran: 他对政府致力和平的承诺提出质疑，并呼吁政府做出友好的表示。

example.ex: There's not greater gesture of love than having someone's name tattooed on your body...
example.tran: 没有比将某人姓名文到身上更绝妙的示爱方式了。

example.ex: As a gesture to security, cars were fitted with special locks.
example.tran: 出于安全上的考虑，这些汽车装上了专用锁。

value.tran: （表明态度或意图的）姿态，表示

value.def: If you gesture, you use movements of your hands or head in order to tell someone something or draw their attention to something.

example.ex: I gestured towards the boathouse, and he looked inside...
example.tran: 我朝船库方向示意，他便往里面瞧了瞧。

example.ex: He gestures, gesticulates, and moves with the grace of a dancer.
example.tran: 他举手投足之间流露出舞者的优雅。

value.tran: 打手势；用手势表示；用动作示意

trans: 悬浮手势；手势感应；说能探测手势的；笔势
姿态识别；手势识别；手势辨识；动作识别；姿势识别
做手势，表示；做一个手势

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to carry, to bring 带来
rootsaffixes.title: gest, gister

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 加强 + gest 带来 → 带来很多 → 充满
di 分开 + gest 带来 → 带下去 → 消化
gest 带来 + iculate 表动作 → 做手势
gest 带来 + ure 表行为 → 能带来信息的动作 → 手势
in 不 + digestion 消化 → 消化不良
re 重新 + gister 带来 → 再次带来〔新来的学生〕→〔学员〕登记，注册
sug 下 + gest 带来 → 从下面带上来〔话〕→ 建议
